lines.text: I suppose this is the end of a beautiful friendship.
My husband never shows his emotions. He's English, you know.
You're not even honest enough to be a crook.
They'll write us into books. We'll be historical.
You can't tell the crooks from the good guys anymore.
I'm sorry, Émile. It's for the best. I'm sure you can find something honest to do with all that old Mongolian clay.
